resources.string: This is an open-source application released under the GPLv3 license. It is free and will remain free. If you really like it or if you are annoyed by ads, please consider donating (via paypal). I will remove the ads for you as soon as possible.\nThank you!
To remove ads, you need to load the noads code. It is available as soon the donation arrives. Please be patient and drop me a mail if it does not work after one day.
To verify your donation your paypal id (mail address) is needed:
You will receive a code back, you have to enter here, to finally remove the ads:
Watch your call, message and data plans!
CallMeter generates reports from call, message and data logs. It supports several modes of billing.
The output format is usage / time or count used this billing period / time or count overall. Monthly time calculation takes the billing mode into account. Overall does not.
The billing mode specifies the length of the first / next billing intervals. E.g. 60/10 means every call is billed for minimum 60s, any longer call is rounded up to next full 10s.
You can split your call or message plan into up to two plans. Each plan can be set to be totally free, capped to a set limit or unlimited.
Your messages can be merged into your call plan. E.g. counting every message as a 15s call.

CallMeter runs in background every 30min (only if not in standby). This means, that deleting calls or messages older than 30min will not change your stats. Deleting calls or messages younger than 30min may result in wrong statistics.
What does CallMeter NG not do:

There is no way to distinguish between sipdroid and real calls or between websms and real sms. Android\'s seamless integration of these apps makes it impossible to retrieve application-specific data from call logs.
Some tips and tricks, how to set up this app.
Follow me on twitter.\nGet update notifications etc.
Set SMS\'s billing period to calls\' period.
First day of your SMS bill
Set data\'s billing period to calls\' period.
First day of your data bill
Don\'t bill some numbers\nwildcards allowed: *555, 555* or *555*
Bill calls to/from excluded numbers in plan #1
Bill calls to/from excluded numbers in plan #2
Bill messages to/from excluded numbers in plan #1
Bill messages to/from excluded numbers in plan #2
Split plan into two different billed plans.
Check hours to include calls/sms into first plan. All others will go into second plan.
Each call will be billed with this.
Each minute of a call will be billed with this.
Each SMS will be billed with this.
Each MB of the traffic is bill with this.
Bill SMS as part of calls.
Number of seconds a billed for a single sms.
Uncheck to merge them into plan 2.
WLAN stats are not collected here!
Data is collected in realtime. First month may be incorrect!
Your billing period starts with each day.
Resetting call/sms data will result in recalculation of the statistics.\n\nResetting traffic statistics is permanent. It only resets traffic done before boot!
Send your device\'s logs to the developer.\nDo this only if you was asked to do so.
SendLog will collect the device log and send it to the developer.\nYou will have an opportunity to review and modify the data being sent.
Install the free SendLog application to collect the device log and send it to the developer.
